data.scheme_name: Revamped Scheme of Fund for Regeneration of Traditional Industries (SFURTI)  - Except NER & Hill States  - Existing
data.benefits: This scheme provides 90% financial assistance to for major cluster (more than 500 Artisans) upto Rs.500 lakh per cluster.
data.eligibility: All units by forming cluster-specific SPVs generating employment opportunities are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Formation of SPV is mandatory to seek the final approval for hard interventions by IA. 
  2. At least 33% of Artisans shall be members of SPV.
data.beneficiaries: All units by forming cluster-specific SPVs generating employment opportunities are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Formation of SPV is mandatory to seek the final approval for hard interventions by IA. 
  2. At least 33% of Artisans shall be members of SPV.
data.nodal_agency:
Khadi and Village Industries Commission
National Institute of MSME
Coir Board.
data.context: This scheme is revamped for those Industries/artisans which require quality infrastructure support to meet customer expectation, survival in a competitive market and to be ready for export by absorbing technology balance.
data.objective: To provide sustained employment for traditional industry artisans and producers.
data.description:
1. The financial assistance provided for any specific project shall be as follows - 
  2. For regular clusters (up to 500 Artisans) - Rs. 200.5 lakh per cluster. 
  3. For major cluster (more than 500 Artisans) - Rs. 500 lakh per cluster. 

Cluster Interventions: 

  1. Soft Intervention - 100% funding max. 10% of the amount of Hard Intervention (HI) or Rs. 25 lakh, whichever is less. 
  2. Hard Interventions - 90% funding Cost of Technical Agency : 100% funding max. 8% of the amount of Hard Intervention (HI) or Rs. 30 lakh, whichever is less. 
  • Cost of IA/SPV including CDE : 100% funding max. 8% of the amount of Hard Intervention (HI) or Rs. 20 lakh, whichever is less.
data.how_to_apply:
The eligible agency/organization has to submit the proposal to the State Office, KVIC and the proposal is to be scrutinized at State Level and Zonal Level before being submitted onwards to the Scheme Steering Committee for approval.
One can register for SFURTI through - https://sfurti.msme.gov.in/SFURTI/SignUp.aspx
data.funding_facilitator: Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
data.funding_mechanism:
Release of funds to Nodal Agency : 

  • Proposal for release of funds will be submitted by Nodal Agencies cluster-wise to Ministry of MSME which will be based on approved Plan of Action (PoA) and progress of expenditure. 
  • The funds will be released to the NAS on receipt of the Utilization Certificate and Progress Report, and the Nodal Agencies shall, in turn, release the fund to the cluster as per the approved Cluster/ Annual Action&nFunds to Nodal Agency will be disbursed under two heads : 
  • SFURTI Programme Fund SFURTI Administrative Fund Release of funds to Implementing Agency After obtaining final approval, a sanction order will be issued by Nodal Agency and the fund will be released in instalments as : 
  1. 1st instalment of 50% of the hard intervention as an advance on Implementing Agency arranging land 
  2. 2nd instalment of another 50% on utilization of 2/3 of 1st instalment Release of fund for soft intervention shall be need-based and a part component of the same is to be released to Implementing Agency after in-principle - approval by Scheme Steering Committee.
data.additional_info:
• NAs to take an undertaking from IA at the time of making application that IA has not availed any financial assistance for the same cluster from any Central/State Government Agency and it should be made part of the DPR.
  • Project intervention:
    • Soft Interventions under the project would consist of activities such as:
      • General awareness, counseling, motivation, and trust-building
      • Skill development and capacity building for the entire value chain with a special focus on the digitization of training modules
      • Machine handling and maintenance training
      • Institution development
      • Exposure visits
      • Market promotion initiatives
      • Design and product development
      • Participation in seminars, workshops, and training programs on technology up-gradation, etc.
    • Hard interventions will include the creation of the following facilities:
      • Common facility centres (CFCs) and worksheds with a provision of IP-enabled CCTV cameras
      • Procurement of machineries
      • Working Capital and Raw material banks (RMBs)
      • Tools and technological up-gradation such as charkha upgradation, tool-kit distribution, etc.
      • Warehousing facility
      • Training center
  • Thematic interventions:
    • In addition to the above-mentioned hard components and soft components, the scheme will also support cross-cutting thematic interventions at the sector level including several clusters in the same sector with emphasis on both domestic and international markets. These will primarily include:
      • Brand building and promotion campaign
      • New media marketing
      • e-Commerce initiatives
      • Innovation
      • Research and development initiatives and technological upgradation of similar groups of clusters based on performance
      • Developing institutional linkages existing & proposed clusters
